Description.val:
The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $4.000 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

This budget provides funding for the in service LPD 17 class program support equipment. Previous funding for LPD 17 class support equipment (FY12 and earlier) was provided under line item OPN 0981, Items Less Than $5 Million. Funding is required to upgrade mission critical electronics and Hull Mechanical & Engineering (HM&E) systems including the Engineering Control Systems (ECS), Ship Control Systems (SCS), Degaussing Systems, Shipboard Wide-Area Network (SWAN), commercial software products for ECS, SCS, Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (C4ISR) and Administrative Communications.

[P40A / CJ010 - Schoolhouse TTE]: CJ010 - SCHOOLHOUSE TTE
Funding for Schoolhouse Technical Training Equipment (TTE) is for the infrastructure and equipment to set up the schoolhouses for multiple systems such as ECS and SCS 60Hz and Ship Service Diesel Generators (SSDG). The schoolhouses will provide critical training to sailors in operation and maintenance of those systems.

[P40A / CJ020 - Shore Based Spares]: CJ020 SHORE BASED SPARES
Shore-Based Spares are critical long lead time items that are staged shore-side in the event of a catastrophic failure on an operational ship.  These spares must be periodically replenished as assets are utilized.  Furthermore, as the LPD 17 Class continues to introduce new ships (additional) to the fleet, the number of spare requirements increases as additional items are added to the spares list to support newer shipboard configurations.

[P40A / CJ080 Conjunctive HM&E AIT]: CJ080 CONJUNCTIVE HM&E ALTERATIONS
Conjunctive HM&E Alterations includes design integration, equipment procurement, recurring equipment engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Services (ILS).

[P3A / CJ030 - HW/SW Obsolescence]: CJ030, CJ032, CJ034, CJ035 LPD 17  Hardware/Software HW/SW Obsolescence effort addresses critical hardware obsolescence and technology refreshment issues and supporting class upgrades focused on increased capability and reliability. Funding will support procurement of hardware and software changes to the systems listed:
-Command Information Display System (CIDS) 23TV, Replace projectors with Light Emitting Diode(LED) Projectors
-Engineering Control Systems (ECS) - Windows XP upgrade
-Ship Control Systems (SCS) - Windows XP upgrade/SCS Tech Refresh, Digital Rudder Angle Display Information System (DRADIS)
-HM&E Network - HM&E Network Upgrades
-Wire-free Portable Communication System (WPCS) - Uninterrupted Power Supply (UPS) Upgrade, Low Power Amplifier Upgrade, Main Site Upgrade.
-27TV - 27TV System Upgrade
-Advanced Fire and Smoke Sensor System (AFSS) - AFSS System Upgrade.
-Integrated Voice Communication System (IVCS) - IVCS system upgrades (local cutout switches, AFT lookout communication mod, obsolete terminal replacement, FWD/AFT Keyswitched Integrated Terminal Equipment (KITE)), Software version 7.2.2
-1MC Announcing System - Digital Microphone Control Station
-Navigational Data Distribution System (NDDS) - NDDS Navigation Network Installation
-Damage Control Action Management System (DCAMS) - Upgrade to Advanced Damage Control System (ADCS)
-Boundary Defense Cyber Security hardening

[P3A - 2 / CJ040 HM&E Electrical Modifications]: CJ040 HM&E ELECTRICAL MODIFICATIONSHM&E Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on electrical systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. HM&E Electrical Modifications include:
SWAN UPS- Space Based UPS Reduction

[P3A - 3 / CJ050 - HM&E Survivability Modifications]: CJ050 HM&E SURVIVABILITY MODIFICATIONS HM&E Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on HM&E systems (impacting ship survivability) and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. HM&E Survivability Modifications include:
-Smoke Ejection System (SES) Redesign
-Composite Ventilation Louvers and Screens.

[P3A - 4 / CJ060 - HM&E Mechanical/Auxiliary Modifications]: CJ060, CJ061, CJ062, CJ063 HM&E MECHANICAL/AUXILIARY MODIFICATIONSHME Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on mechanical and auxiliary systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. HM&E Mechanical/ Auxiliary Modifications include:
-MIDE Bulkhead Shaft Seal
-Helo Hangar Door Control Modifications
-Vacuum Collection, Holding & Transfer (VCHT) Ejector Pump PLC Upgrade
-2nd Pass Reverse Osmosis (RO) Unit Upgrade, RO Unit Potable Water Electrolytic Disinfectant Generator (EDG) Recirculation Capability
-Aviation Maintenance Bridge Crane Replacement
-Knuckleboom Crane Improvements
-Geislinger Coupling Improvements
-Scullery Improvements
-Gaylord System Improvements
-Branch Piping Modifications
-Titanium valve replacement
-Common Fuel Rail

[P3A - 5 / CJ070 SWAN-CANES Integration]: CJ070 SWAN-CANES Integration
The results of the Shipboard Wide Area Network (SWAN) / Consolidated Afloat Networks and Enterprise Services (CANES) study directed the replacement of the C4I capability of the LPD 17 Class SWAN with CANES and the conversion of the non-C4I SWAN into a new HM&E Network (mini SWAN).   SWAN funding is required to field the new HM&E Network in support of the CANES  installation.  In addition, funding is required to sustain the legacy SWAN, while the LPD 17 Class ships await the CANES/HM&E Network back fit installation.   SWAN serves as the backbone of the LPD 17 class and funding is necessary to address obsolescence, reliability issues, performance concerns, emergent Fleet requirements including enabling Cryptologic Log On (CLO), eradicating Windows XP, replacing aging obsolete network hardware (e.g., servers and core switches), and maintaining the Information Assurance posture of the Common Operating Environment (COE).   This funding is vital to ensure the LPD 17 Class ships can combat the evolving cyber threat.

Name.@footnote: CJ080- CONJUNCTIVE HM&E ALTERATIONS   (FY19) Advanced Planning Long Lead Time Material in support of FY20 planned availabilities for LPD 17, LPD 18 and LPD 26.

HW/SW Obsolescence (CJ030) includes funding for procurement and installation of equipment to correct critical obsolescence issues on LPD17 Class mission systems. Shipsets of equipment vary in quantities and types of components each fiscal year and within a fiscal year. Each ship requires a different number of alterations to be installed, and these alteration packages vary in scope and cost based on individual ship configurations. A quantity of "1" represents a single "kit" intended for installation in one ship, in a single Chief of Naval Operations (CNO) Availability. Ships may be receiving more than 1 kit in a single availability based upon the fielding plan for the systems being modernized. In FY18, there are a total of (13) kits being procured for installations during (4) FY19 CNO Availabilities on LPD 20 (3 kit), LPD 21 (1 kit), LPD 23 (4 kit), and LPD 24 (5 kit). In Fy19, there are (23) total kits being procured for installation during (4) FY20 CNO Availabilities on LPD 17 (5 kit), LPD 18 (4 kit), LPD 25 (9 kit), and LPD 26 (5 kit). In FY20, there are (10) total kits being procured for installation during (3) FY21 CNO Availabilities on LPD 19 (4 kit), LPD 22 (4 kit), and LPD 27 (2 kit).  In FY21, there is (7) total kits being procured for installation during (3) FY22 CNO Availability on LPD 21 (3 kit), LPD 23 (3 kit), and LPD 28 (1 kit). In FY22, there are (7) total kits being procured for installation during (5) FY23 CNO Availabilities on LPD 17 (1 kit), LPD 18 (1 kit), LPD 20 (2 kit), LPD 24 (1 kit), and LPD 26 (2 kit). In FY23, there are (3) total kits being procured for installation during (2) FY24 CNO Availabilities on LPD 19 (1 kit), and LPD 25 (2 kit).   DSA costs will also vary by kit due to differences in scope and complexity, and first installation compared to follow-on installations.

Description.val:
HW/SW Obsolescence (CJ030) includes funding for procurement and installation of equipment to correct critical obsolescence issues on LPD17 Class mission systems. Resolves operational and obsolescence issues.  Replaces current split controllers, resolves rack cooling, modifies loud speaker cable plant, and provides commonality and system architecture and hardware. Shipsets of equipment vary in quantities and types of components each fiscal year and within a fiscal year. Each ship requires a different number of alterations to be installed, and these alteration packages vary in scope and cost based on individual ship configurations. A quantity of "1" represents a single "kit" intended for installation in one ship, in a single Chief of Naval Operations (CNO) Availability. Ships may be receiving more than 1 kit in a single availability based upon the fielding plan for the systems being modernized.  In FY18, there are a total of (13) kits being procured for installations during (4) FY19 CNO Availabilities on LPD 20 (3 kit), LPD 21 (1 kit), LPD 23 (4 kit), and LPD 24 (5 kit). In FY19, there are (23) total kits being procured for installation during (4) FY20 CNO Availabilities on LPD 17 (5 kit), LPD 18 (4 kit), LPD 25 (9 kit), and LPD 26 (5 kit). In FY20, there are (10) total kits being procured for installation during (3) FY21 CNO Availabilities on LPD 19 (4 kit), LPD 22 (4 kit), and LPD 27 (2 kit).  In FY21, there is (7) total kits being procured for installation during (3) FY22 CNO Availability on LPD 21 (3 kit), LPD 23 (3 kit), and LPD 28 (1 kit). In FY22, there are (7) total kits being procured for installation during (5) FY23 CNO Availabilities on LPD 17 (1 kit), LPD 18 (1 kit), LPD 20 (2 kit), LPD 24 (1 kit), and LPD 26 (2 kit). In FY23, there are (3) total kits being procured for installation during (2) FY24 CNO Availabilities on LPD 19 (1 kit), and LPD 25 (2 kit).

DSA costs will also vary by kit due to differences in scope and complexity, and first installation compared to follow-on installations.

[HW/SW Obsolescence] HW/SW Obsolescence effort addresses hardware obsolescence/technology refreshment issues, and class upgrades focused on increased capabilities, force protection, and safety. Funding will support procurement of hardware and software changes to the systems listed:
-Command Information Display System (CIDS) 23TV - HW refresh and upgrade to Windows 10
-Rudder Angle Indicator
-Ship Control Systems (SCS) - Windows XP upgrade/SCS Tech Refresh, Digital Rudder Angle Display Information System (DRADIS)
-Fire Detection System Upgrade Phase 1
-Wire-free Portable Communication System (WPCS) - Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) Upgrade, Low Power Amplifier Upgrade
-27TV - 27TV Low Channel Pier Cable Blockage improvement
-Advanced Fire and Smoke Sensor System (AFSS) - AFSS System Upgrade
-Integrated Voice Communication System (IVCS)- IVCS system upgrades (local cutout switches, AFT lookout communication mod, obsolete terminal replacement, FWD/AFT KITE), Software version 7.2.2.
-1MC Announcing System - Digital Microphone Control Station1MC improvements
-Navigational Data Distribution System (NDDS) - Sustainment and obsolescence upgrades, Navigation display upgrades
-Damage Control Action Management Software (DCAMS) - Upgrade to Advanced Damage Control System

[Non-Recurring Engineering] NRE Includes the following efforts:
FY18: Technology refresh for Announcing System 1MC will upgrade system firmware and obsolete components in the AN/SIA-134 Announcing System Racks. Technology refresh in support of NDDS Sustainment and Obsolescence upgrades.
FY23: Conduct engineering studies in support of LPD 17 Class Midlife Planning to include Weight, Moment, and Stability, Corrosion, Space and Equipment Configuration, and Internal Communication Upgrades. Non Recurring Engineering and Advanced Planning Long Lead Time Material in support of planned Midlife installations.

Name.@footnote: HM&E Electrical Modification (CJ040) includes funding for procurement and installation of equipment to upgrade shipboard electrical systems to a more sustainable, reliable configuration on LPD17 Class ships. Shipsets of equipment vary in quantities and types of components each fiscal year and within a fiscal year. A quantity of "1" represents a single "kit" intended for installation in one ship, in a single CNO Availability. Ships may be receiving more than 1 kit in a single availability based upon the fielding plan for the systems being modernized. In FY18, there are (2) total kits being procured for installation during (2) FY19 CNO Availabilities on LPD 23 (1 kit), LPD 24 (1 kit). In FY19, there are (3) total kits being procured for installation during (3) FY20 CNO Availabilities on LPD 17 (1 kit), LPD 18 (1 kit), and LPD 25 (1 kit). In FY20, there are (3) total kits being procured for installation (3) FY21 CNO Availability on LPD 19 (1 kit), LPD 22 (1 kit), and LPD 27 (1 kit).  In FY21, there is (1) total kit being procured for installation during (1) FY22 CNO Availability on LPD 21 (1 kit).  In FY22, there are (2) total kits being procured for installation during (2) FY23 CNO Availability on LPD 20 (1 kit) and LPD 26 (1 kit). Funding supports safety and capability improvements in the design of the Space Based UPS. This results in a more robust system configuration, requiring additional cable runs, load center tie-in, battery placements, and industrial work efforts.  DSA costs will also vary by kit due to differences in scope and complexity, and first installation compared to follow-on installations.

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: HM&E Electrical Upgrades

Description.val:
[HM&E Electrical Upgrades] HM&E Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on electrical systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. HM&E Electrical Modifications include:
SWAN UPS - Space Based Uninterruptable Power Supply (UPS) Reduction

The installation fielding plan for this cost code has been adjusted to align with Consolidated Afloat Networks and Enterprise Services (CANES) installations aboard LPD 17 Class ships. This alignment has been completed to reduce the operational burden on ship's force, and reduce re-work during CANES installations.

[Non-Recurring Engineering] NRE Includes the following efforts:
FY23: Conduct engineering studies in support of LPD 17 Class Midlife Planning to include support of USMC equities in upgraded Lithium Ion battery stowage and upgraded power and energy storage requirements for combat systems.

[HM&E Survivability Modifications] HM&E Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on HM&E systems (impacting ship survivability) and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. HM&E Survivability Modifications include:

Name.@footnote: HM&E Mechanical/Auxiliary Modifications (CJ060) includes funding for procurement and installation of equipment to support upgrades of shipboard mechanical/auxiliary systems to a more sustainable, reliable configuration on LPD17 Class ships. Shipsets of equipment vary in quantities and types of components each fiscal year and within a fiscal year. Each ship requires a different number of alterations to be installed, and these alteration packages vary in scope and cost based on individual ship configurations. A quantity of "1" represents a single "kit" intended for installation in one ship, in a single CNO Availability. Ships may be receiving more than 1 kit in a single availability being modernized.  In FY18, there are (7) total kits being procured for installation during (4) FY19 CNO Availabilities on LPD 20 (2 kits), LPD 21 (1 kit), LPD 23 (2 kits), and LPD 24 (2 kits). In FY19, there are (14) total kits being procured for installation during (4) FY20 CNO Availabilities on LPD 17 (5 kits), LPD 18 (5 kits), LPD 25 (3 kits), and LPD 26 (1 kit). In FY20, there are (14) total kits being procured for installation during (4) FY21 CNO Availabilities on LPD 19 (5 kits), LPD 20 (3 kits), LPD 22 (4 kits), and LPD 27 (2 kits).  In FY21, there are (4) total kits being procured for installation during (2) FY22 CNO Availabilities on LPD 21 (3 kits) and LPD 23 (1 kit). In FY22, there are (3) total kits being procured for installation during (3) FY23 CNO Availabilities on LPD 20 (1 kit), LPD 24 (1 kit), and LPD 26 (1 kits). In FY23, there is a total of (1) kit being procured for (1) CNO Availability on LPD 25 (1 kit).  DSA costs will also vary by kit due to differences in scope and complexity, and first installation compared to follow-on installations.  Unit cost increase from FY18 to FY19 is due to the following: A total of (7) kits will be procured in FY18: (1) kit of Branch Piping Mods, (3) kits Helicopter Hanger Door Control Mods, and (3) kits Aviation Maintenance Bridge Crane Replacements.   A total of (14) kits will be procured in FY19: (1) kit Reverse Osmosis Unit Piping Upgrade, (4) kits Branch Piping Mods, (2) kits Bulkhead Shaft Seals, (1) kit Helicopter Hanger Door Control Mod, (3) kits Aviation Maintenance Bridge Crane Replacements, and (3) kits Scullery Redesigns.   The (2) kits for the Bulkhead Shaft Seals account for the unit cost increase from FY18 to FY19.  Two (2) FY16 procurements originally scheduled to be installed in FY17 on LPD 20 were deferred to FY19 due to a delay in delivery of material.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: CJ060 HM&E Mechanical/Auxiliary Modifications

Description.val:
HM&E Mechanical/Auxiliary Modifications(CJ060) includes funding for procurement and installation of equipment to support upgrades of shipboard mechanical/auxiliary systems to a more sustainable, reliable configuration on LPD17 Class ships. Shipsets of equipment vary in quantities and types of components each fiscal year and within a fiscal year. Each ship requires a different number of alterations to be installed, and these alteration packages vary in scope and cost based on individual ship configurations. A quantity of "1" represents a single "kit" intended for installation in one ship, in a single CNO Availability. Ships may be receiving more than 1 kit in a single availability based upon the fielding plan for the systems being modernized.
HM&E Mechanical/Auxiliary Modifications include:
-MIDE Bulkhead Shaft Seal
-Helo Hangar Door Control Modifications
-Vacuum Collection, Holding & Transfer (VCHT) Ejector Pump PLC Upgrade
-2nd Pass Reverse Osmosis (RO) Unit Upgrade, RO Unit Potable Water Electrolytic Disinfectant Generator (EDG) Recirculation Capability
-Aviation Maintenance Bridge Crane Replacement
-Geislinger Coupling Improvements
-Scullery Improvements
-Gaylord System Improvements
-Branch Piping Modifications

[Non-Recurring Engineering] NRE includes the following efforts:
FY18: Conduct Non-recurring engineering in support of Scullery redesign.
FY23: Conduct engineering studies in support of LPD 17 Class Midlife Planning to include Crane improvement/replacement, corrosion, weight and moment, USMC priorities, and reefer system upgrades.

Name.@footnote: This mod has sharp fluctuations in procurement and installation unit cost due to the variations in equipment quantities and types of components that make up a shipset.  Each ship requires a different number of alterations to be installed, and these alteration packages vary in scope and cost based on individual ship configurations.  Due to Type Commander (TYCOM) Integrated Class Maintenance Plan(ICMP) scheduling adjustments, CNO availabilities for LPD 17 Class have increased from once every 2 years to once every 3 years.  This has caused CANES and HM&E Network schedules to slip and SWAN sustainment modification quantities to increase.

FY18 Availabilities: LPD 19 - SWAN Server; SWAN COMPOSE 4.0.1; Network Storage Device;  SIPRNET CLO COMPOSE 4.0; NIPRNET CLO COMPOSE 4.0; SWAN Workstation PC; SWAN Virtualization Mgt LAN; Windows 10 SHB; Enclave Boundary Defense Capability. LPD 22 - SWAN Mesh CORE Switch; SWAN Server; SWAN COMPOSE 4.0.1; Network Router; Network Storage Device;  SIPRNET CLO COMPOSE 4.0; NIPRNET CLO COMPOSE 4.0; SWAN Workstation PC; SWAN Virtualization Mgt LAN; Windows 10 SHB; Enclave Boundary Defense Capability. LPD 21 - SWAN COMPOSE 4.0.1; SIPRNET CLO COMPOSE 4.0; NIPRNET CLO COMPOSE 4.0; SWAN Workstation PC; SWAN Virtualization Mgt LAN; Windows 10 SHB; Enclave Boundary Defense Capability. LPD 27 - Windows 10 SHB Requirement. FY19 Availabilities: LPD 23 - SWAN Removal Ring; HM&E Conversion Ring. LPD 24 - SWAN Removal Ring; HM&E Conversion Ring.

SWAN funding is required to field the new HM&E Network in support of the CANES  installation.  In addition, funding is required to sustain the legacy SWAN, while the LPD 17 Class ships await the CANES/HM&E Network back fit installation.   SWAN serves as the backbone of the LPD 17 class and funding is necessary to address obsolescence, reliability issues, performance concerns, emergent Fleet requirements including enabling Cryptologic Log On (CLO), eradicating Windows XP, replacing aging obsolete network hardware (e.g., servers and core switches), and maintaining the Information Assurance posture of the Common Operating Environment (COE).   This funding is vital to ensure the LPD 17 Class ships can combat the evolving cyber threat.

Name.@footnote: ) HM&E MECHANICAL/AUXILIARY MODIFICATIONSHME Modernization, Titanium Valve Replacement Phase II funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on mechanical and auxiliary systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. Shipsets of equipment vary in quantities and types of components each fiscal year and within a fiscal year. Each ship requires a different number of alterations to be installed, and these alteration packages vary in scope and cost based on individual ship configurations. A quantity of "1" represents a single "kit" intended for installation in one ship, in a single Chief of Naval Operations (CNO) Availability. Ships may be receiving more than 1 kit in a single availability based upon the fielding plan for the systems being modernized. In FY18, there are (3) total kits being procured for installation during (1) FY19 CNO Availability and (2) FY20 CNO Availability on LPD 21 (1 kit for FY19), LPD 17 (1 kit for FY20) and LPD 18 (1 kit for FY20). In FY19, there are (3) total kits being procured for installation during (3) FY21 CNO Availabilities on LPD 19 (1 kit) and LPD 20 (1 kit), and LPD 22 (1 kit).  DSA costs will also vary by kit due to differences in scope and complexity, and first installation compared to follow-on installations.  All Phase II procurements have been moved to A-2 years prior to installation, vice A-1 year prior to installation, due to actual lead times seen on previously procured ship sets. Once exception to this change is (1) kit being procured in FY18 for LPD 21 FY19 CNO Availability, which will be still be procured at A-1 years. The procurement of (1) kit for LPD 21 FY19 CNO Availability has remained an A-1 year prior to installation procurement because funding was not available to accelerate the procurement once actual lead times were known.

Description.val:
[Titanium Valve Replacement Phase 1] TITANIUM VALVE REPLACEMENT (CJ061)Titanium Valve Replacement Phase I: Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on mechanical and auxiliary systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. Funding will support Phase I of the Titanium valve replacement.

Funding will support Phase II of the Titanium valve replacement.

All Phase II procurements have been moved to A-2 years prior to installation, vice A-1 year prior to installation, due to actual lead times seen on previously procured ship sets. Once exception to this change is (1) kit being procured in FY18 for LPD 21 FY19 CNO Availability, which will be still be procured at A-1 years. The procurement of (1) kit for LPD 21 FY19 CNO Availability has remained an A-1 year prior to installation procurement because funding was not available to accelerate the procurement once actual lead times were known.

Funding will support Phase III of the Titanium valve replacement.

All Phase III procurements have been moved to A-2 years prior to installation, vice A-1 year prior to installation, due to actual lead times seen on previously procured ship sets.

ModificationTitle.val: CJ062 HM&E Mechanical/Auxiliary Mods Knuckleboom Crane Improvements

Title.val: CJ062 HM&E Mechanical/Auxiliary Mods Knuckleboom Crane Improvements

Name.@footnote: HM&E MECHANICAL/AUXILIARY MODIFICATIONSHME Modernization Knuckleboom Crane Improvement funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on mechanical and auxiliary systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns.  Shipsets of equipment vary in quantities and types of components each fiscal year and within a fiscal year. Each ship requires a different number of alterations to be installed, and these alteration packages vary in scope and cost based on individual ship configurations. A quantity of "1" represents a single "kit" intended for installation in one ship, in a single Chief of Naval Operations (CNO) Availability. Ships may be receiving more than 1 kit in a single availability based upon the fielding plan for the systems being modernized.  In FY18, there are (2) total kits being procured for installation during (2) FY19 CNO Availabilities on LPD 20 (1 kit) and LPD 23 (1 kit). In FY19, there are (2) total kits being procured for installation during (2) FY20 CNO Availabilities on LPD 18 (1 kit), LPD 25 (1 kit). In FY20, there are (3) total kits being procured for installation during (3) FY21 CNO Availabilities on LPD 19 (1 kit) and LPD 22 (1 kit) and LPD 27 (1 kit). In FY21, there is (1) total kit being procured for installation during (1) FY22 CNO Availability on LPD 21 (1 kit). In FY22, there are (3) total kits being procured for installation during (3) FY23 CNO Availabilities on LPD 17 (1 kit) and LPD 24 (1 kit), and LPD 26 (1 kit).  DSA costs will also vary by kit due to differences in scope and complexity, and first installation compared to follow-on installations.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: Knuckleboom Crane Improvement

Description.val:
[Knuckleboom Crane Improvement] KNUCKLEBOOM CRANE IMPROVEMENTS Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on mechanical and auxiliary systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. Funding will support boat and cargo crane safety upgrades.

[Non-Recurring Engineering] NRE include the following efforts:
FY17: Non-recurring engineering in support of Knuckleboom Crane safety improvements to include interlock switches, e-stops, secure anchor points, crane cab ventilation, and access point for emergency egress.

Shipsets of equipment vary in quantities and types of components each fiscal year and within a fiscal year. Each ship requires a different number of alterations to be installed, and these alteration packages vary in scope and cost based on individual ship configurations. A quantity of "1" represents a single "kit" intended for installation in one ship, in a single Chief of Naval Operations (CNO) Availability. Ships maybe receiving more than 1 kit in a single availability based upon the fielding plan for the systems being modernized.  In FY20, there is (1) total kit being procured for installation during (1) FY21 CNO Availabilities on LPD 22 (1 kit). In FY22, there are (4) total kits being procured for installation during (4) FY23 CNO Availabilities on LPD 17 (1 kit), LPD 20 (1 kit), LPD 24 (1 kit) and LPD 26 (1 kit). ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: Common Fuel Rail

Description.val: [Common Fuel Rail] FUEL INJECTION COMMON RAIL Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on Main Propulsion Diesel Engine (MPDE) systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. Funding will support developing and installing a high-pressure, electronically-controlled fuel injection rail system.

Name.@footnote: NAVIGATION DATA DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM (NDDS) NETWORK INSTALLATION Modernization funding is provided to create an independent Navigation Network, removing the current NDDS equipment connection from the Hull Mechanical & Electrical (HM&E) network. This will include hardware and software upgrades that will also address obsolescence in the system, and address Cyber Security requirements.  Shipsets of equipment vary in quantities and types of components each fiscal year and within a fiscal year. Each ship requires a different number of alterations to be installed, and these alteration packages vary in scope and cost based on individual ship configurations. A quantity of "1" represents a single "kit" intended for installation in one ship, in a single Chief of Naval Operations (CNO) Availability. Ships may be receiving more than 1 kit in a single availability based upon the fielding plan for the systems being modernized. In FY20, there one (1) kit being procured for installation during (1) FY21 CNO Availabilities on LPD 19 (1 kit). In FY 22, there are (2) total kits being procured for installation during (2) FY23 CNO Availabilities on LPD 20 (1 kit) and LPD 26 (1 kit).  DSA costs will also vary by kit due to differences in scope and complexity, and first installation compared to follow-on installations.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: NDDS NAVIGATION NETWORK INSTALLATION

Description.val:
[NDDS NAVIGATION NETWORK INSTALLATION] NAVIGATION DATA DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM (NDDS) NETWORK INSTALLATION Modernization funding is provided to create an independent Navigation Network, removing the current NDDS equipment connection from the Hull Mechanical & Electrical (HM&E) network. This will include hardware and software upgrades that will also address obsolescence in the system, and address Cyber Security requirements.

[NDDS Non-Recurring] NRE includes the following efforts:
FY19: Non-Recurring Engineering in support of NDDS Navigation Network Installation includes hardware obsolescence and upgrade of software operating system to Red Hat Linux.

Name.@footnote: CYBER REQUIREMENT Modernization funding is provided to implement cyber resiliency principles, a Defense-in-Depth Functional Implementation Architecture (DFIA), Boundary Defense Capabilities and Situational Awareness tools. Shipsets of equipment vary in quantities and types of components each fiscal year and within a fiscal year. Each ship requires a different number of alterations to be installed, and these alteration packages vary in scope and cost based on individual ship configurations. A quantity of "1" represents a single "kit" intended for installation in one ship, in a single Chief of Naval Operations (CNO) Availability. Ships may be receiving more than 1 kit in a single availability based upon the fielding plan for the systems being modernized. In FY21, there are a total of (2) kits being procured in support of (2) FY22 CNO Availabilities on LPD 23 (1 kit) and LPD 28 (1 kit). In FY22, there are at total of (2) kits being procured in support of (2) FY23 CNO Availabilities on LPD 17 (1 kit) and LPD 24 (1) kit. In FY23, there are a total of (3) kits being procured in support of (3) FY24 CNO Availabilities on LPD 19 (1 kit), LPD 22 (1 kit), and LPD 25 (1 kit).  DSA costs will also vary by kit due to differences in scope and complexity, and first installation compared to follow-on installations.
